  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    PwAdLoader<T>
    Used for requesting multiple ads to display.
    PwAdvertisingModule
    The MaaS Advertising module.
    PwBannerAdView
    Banners are ads that are shown within the layout of your app.
    PwInterstitialAd
    Interstitials are full screen ads that display in their own Activity.
    PwNativeAd
    Native ads are advertisments designed to fit naturally into your app's look and feel.
    PwVideoInterstitialAd
    Video interstitials are full screen ads that display a video ad in their own Activity.

Package com.phunware.advertising Description

MaaS Advertising SDK for Android

Version 2.2.0

This is Phunware’s Android SDK for the MaaS Advertising module. Visit http://maas.phunware.com/ for more details and to sign up.

Requirements

  • Android SDK 4.0.3 (API level 15) or above
  • MaaS Core v1.3.13 or greater
  • Google Play Services to enable Advertising ID support (recommended); installation instructions here

Getting Started

  • Download the MaaS Advertising SDK and run the included sample app.
  • Continue reading below for installation and integration instructions.
  • Be sure to read the documentation for additional details.

Installation

The following libraries are required:

PWCore-1.3.13.jar

MaaS Advertising depends on the MaaS Core SDK, which is available here: https://github.com/phunware/maas-core-android-sdk

With version 2.2.0 of the Advertising SDK, it is recommended that you use the Android Archive file (.aar). This is the modern format for Android libraries and provides improved support. JAR versions of the SDK are provided for legacy compatibility but may be phased out in the future.

Consult the instructions of your development tools on how to add the libraries to your app project.

In Android Studio, you can add the libraries as modules to your project using the menu option File->New->New Module and selecting “Import .JAR/.AAR Package”. Then add the library modules as dependencies of your app in the File->Project Structure window.

Update your AndroidManifest.xml to include the following permissions and activity:

<uses-permission android:name="android.permission.INTERNET"/>
<uses-permission android:name="android.permission.ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE"/>

<!-- Inside of the application tag: -->
<activity
android:name="com.phunware.advertising.internal.PwAdActivity"
android:configChanges="keyboard|keyboardHidden|orientation|screenSize" />
